posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

Since NDErs are representative of the population as a whole, and they are all convinced, then 100% of the population become convinced that there is an afterlife when they have a sufficiently deep NDE themselves. When you dream and wake up, you instantly realize that life is more real than your dreams. When you have an NDE, the same thing is happening, but on a higher level, as you immediately realize that life is the deep dream and the NDE world is the undeniably real world by comparison.

Or as one person quoted in pic related summarized their NDE:

>"As my soul left my body, I found myself floating in a swirling ocean of multi-colored light. At the end, I could see and feel an even brighter light pulling me toward it, and as it shined on me, I felt indescribable happiness. I remembered everything about eternity - knowing, that we had always existed, and that all of us are family. Then old friends and loved ones surrounded me, and I knew without a doubt I was home, and that I was so loved."

Needless to say, even ultraskeptical neuroscientists are convinced by really deep NDEs.

>>71718875
Elliot was the only one I could genuinely relate to as he explained vividly the insanity of his own mind consuming him. Documenting his mental deterioration with such detail , I was able to see him reflecting my own feelings. The increasing disdain he had for society, the lashing out and the video of him lashing out all mimicked my own feeling of a society backing me into a corner. Whether society is actually backing the person into the corner in reality does not matter. It is that feeling of ostracization which really gets to you. Elliot just couldn't tolerate it and lashed out in a violent fashion. Whether that is the right course of action is for others to judge, I don't like the criminal aspect of him but I liked his explanation of this ostracised feeling he had.

Funnily enough, what is popular right now are figures who listen to people who feel left out and speaks to them through their own "truth". Unless governments really act to show care to their citizens, the boiling anger that festers beneath society will continue . We feel this everywhere in terms of strikes and voting preferences.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
hello, currently stuck between INFP and ISFP. have also considered ENFP / ESFP but i am intensely introverted these days. genuinely confused if i favor Se or Ne, either as a Dom or aux, mainly due to my imagination and interests.

in childhood and up to the present i have had this unshakable inertia towards physicality, and have a very hard time living in the present. after being physical, eg. dancing or playing sport, i usually have a weird sense of guilt or unease with my body, which leads me to believe i do not favor Se. HOWEVER, some of my most treasured memories revolve around the sensory (traveling, being amongst ancient historical sites and ruins, overwhelming transcendent experiences of love and emotional comfort, friendship), and my imagination mainly crafts worlds that are enjoyable to be in, such as bizarre pagan cults i imagine my life taking place within. however, i am not sure if these are generated as a result of my appreciation for the pure sensory pleasure of these places / imaginary lands, or due to the emotional / philosophical qualities they mirror from my own values (such as innocence, purity, simplicity, honesty). this makes me think that i may have Se in my stack.

a few other things that may be helpful for anyone wanting to waste time on me, that i view as potentially being related to these axes: i am interested in things insofar as i relate them to humanity, my self, and the experiences these objects may hold, as in when i study language, i am motivated by the situations i imagine these words to have been used in, such as the breadth of humanity and sorrow and emotion held within each word, which at first glance may appear sterile and one dimensional. the reason I mention this is due to my tendency towards my imagination in regards to these realizations / connections, as i do find emotional intensity within imagining the sensory experience of these things; so its hard to know whether this reflects Ne - Si or Ni - Se.

I often care a great amount for people that I barely know - or don't know at all - because I can see they have a kind soul without them meaning to show it. Yet I seldom act on my feelings, because I know there is little I can do about them. Thus people often don't know that I care at all, or assume that I don't.

Is a kind or compassionate disposition wasted if it isn't made an object of action, or if the recipient never knows it's there? Does it need to have a material object? Or will it find its object somewhere in the future?

"Tell me now: how did gold come to have the highest value? Because it
is uncommon and useless and gleaming and mild in its luster; it bestows
itself always.
Only as the image of the highest virtue did gold come to have the
highest value. Goldlike gleams the gaze of the bestower. Golden luster
makes peace between moon and sun.
Uncommon is the highest virtue and useless, it is gleaming and mild
in its luster: a bestowing virtue is the highest virtue."
>>71732842
It might be more accurate to say Ni and Te correspond to mind mapping while Ne and Ti correspond to brainstorming (judging vs prospecting).

It could be interesting to consider why. Thinking is what you do when you don't understand something; you think about it. It is rational, but the unconscious can inject into thought things which were unthought, so introverted thinking can use an almost unlimited variety of ideas, which is not the case with extroverted thinking, which is concerned with what is objectively correct.

Intuition is irrational so this doesn't apply, only the extrovert's intuitions will always be incited by new objects, while the introvert's might go wherever they are led by the unconscious.

>>71736750
>difference between religion and spirituality
You could define it as:

Religion: systematic expression of belief in something supernatural and defined
Spirituality: unconstrained pursuits for the supernatural
(Mysticism: practices for personal direct experiences of the supernatural)
(Occultism: systematic studies and practices of control over the supernatural)

Funny thing is, even with how separate (and similar) these definitions may be, they're neither necessarily inclusive nor exclusive. It depends on what you're looking at and through what focus.

>1. Include shadow stack theory, then somehow find a way to address the possibility of loop/grip dynamics both within the shadow stack and in the interconnections between the main stack and the shadow stack;
All contrived memes to work around the fact that the four-letter codes do not have a unanimous correspondence to functions. 60-40 % preference is not the same as 90-10 % preference, having a stronger preference on one dichotomy than another means that the four-letter codes are actually not monolithic entities. Shocking revelation only to type dynamics geniuses, as it's otherwise well known in the field of personality psychology.

Another meme stack won't change the underlying reality of traits, not IEIEI, not EIII, not EEII.

Do you mean "easy" as in easy or "easy" as in engaging?
When you say "social skills" it makes me think you are trying to figure out how to say things in a more engaging way?
Asking questions is always good, touching on multiple things at once is always good.
Like if somebody asks me, "What's your favorite game?" I can say,
>I like Skyrim
Or I could say
>I like Skyrim, (answer) I love open-world games, (opens the conversation a bit more) not as a big as a fan of the other Elder Scrolls games (gives an opinion that can be agreed or disagreed with) I like to play a barbarian and wield a two-handed sword, (I like to play a barbarian and wield a two-handed sword) what's your favorite game? (Asks a question, puts the other person in a position where they sorta have to answer, their answer carries the conversation more)
You have to add substance and something unique to what you're saying while still being approachable.
>I like Skyrim and it's better than Morrowind because *reasons*
Is more engaging than
>I like Skyrim, it's a fun game, I like it a lot
When in doubt ask a question.
I hope I answered your post properly.

I see.
>challenge
I will see it as cooperation. I hope you're okay with that.
Just let me specify that the reply will come from "grounded" perspective (or, alternatively, perspective like "the material world does not have an inherent and complete futility in its nature of being").

>"just fools outsourcing their selfhood to pseudo-tribalism based on vaguely defined standards" as if that was something bad when it applies to basically any group except the four fundamental forces
Through its wording, "Vaguely Defined Standards" (I didn't put much thought into wording, but I'm lucky it's good enough for easy development of intended statement, so I'll roll with it) can be defined as standards based on descriptions stuck between subjective and objective, not having stable roots in both & belonging to neither in particular (and having a narrow scope of any use). Maybe even just "standards based on descriptions that don't fit the essences of the terms they are supposed to describe".
No matter the origin, I'd argue it would be good enough to say VDS comes from replication crisis, poor theory quality, (something >>71747440 brings up), shoddy methodology, insufficient data, logical fallacies, conflicts of interest & whatnot.
Psychology (and other scientific fields) do suffer from this:
https://sci-hub.se/https://doi.org/10.1146/annurev-clinpsy-050718-095710

What I think is worth adding is that subjective & objective can be properly tied together through scope of evolutionary psychology (but careful with "appeal to nature" fallacy here).
And so, something like MBTI type is not even a relative your body shares genes with (objective), and it's not a familiar person you like (subjective).
VDS (aside from having use in casual interactions and as a conduit of further research) is where psyche, if not kept in check, may try to achieve Ego inflation by getting Self obsessed with said VDS.

I'm grateful you asked, otherwise I wouldn't get to streamline my thoughts this way.

I may have conveyed my point poorly. The problem is not emotional investment, it is emotional investment in unreal abstractions. This happens with modern identity-formation, where people identify with a group, and suddenly feel that they share in the group's experiences and "trauma" and so on. This is a relatively recent psychological phenomena (of the past few centuries), which observers have noted since the first nationalist movements, i.e that they are essentially abstract performances/inventions.

Of course it would be absurd to suggest that Plato "identified" as an Athenian the way modern people do. He didn't; it's just what he was. If he were to discover one day that his ancestry were completely different, he would have very good reason to be emotionally distressed, as that is a quite tangible affair of direct personal relevance.

>>71750270
>poor theory quality

My biggest personal gripes are:
1. Conflation of gut feeling, abstract thinking, irrational thinking, convergent thinking, long-term thinking and actual intuition into "Ni";
2. Conflation of abstract thinking, irrational thinking, and imagination (or creative thinking) into "Ne";
3. Conflation of pattern comparison, pattern compilation, abstract thinking, analytical thinking into "Ti";
4. Conflation of rational thinking, analytical thinking, pattern organization, pattern expression into "Te";
5. Conflation of recollection of personally experienced patterns, pattern comparison (or let's just call it memory and what's related to it), senses coming from bodily signals and analytical thinking into "Si";
6. Conflation of five bodily senses, proprioception and senses coming from bodily signals into "Se" (at that point, why not include senses from receptors that detect levels of oxygen in some arteries?);
7. Conflation of sympathy, emotion experience depth and personal morals into "Fi";
8. Conflation of empathy, emotion experience frequency and group morals into "Fe".
Which further gives band-aids like loops, grips, "shadow stack" and "middle realm from active imagination" (I'd almost argue that last one justifies all the clutter)

I could have gotten something wrong or have said not enough, of course, so one may stack a reinterpretation on top of my reinterpretation (I wouldn't mind) on something that was reinterpreted (MBTI) from the extensive yet vague interpretations made in PT.
All what I see is a need in a typology that is more streamlined. Maybe based on what can be replicated, including neuroscience (that progressed well since PT (1921)).
Just saying though, it's all merely a hobby for me.

As someone in these threads said, within reason, there are rarely inherently completely right or wrong ways to go with social interactions. Right for what? Wrong for what?
If it's undisputed, it may be falsely perceived as correct just by virtue of being undisputed. Or, in polar reverse, as being incorrect because it wasn't tested.
Not that it's not silly to think people can't think for themselves.
Sometimes there's nothing really to address with anything good whatsoever, even.
Ahh, ranting is nice.

>>71753209
>what is different from this and "abstracting the world" or whatever?
Abstracting the world is to take the details that your senses pick up from the world and remove it from the object it was attached to.
The fuzziness of a particular branch on a bush whose flowers are purple, as a super basic example. Both the fuzziness and the vibrancy of the purple are abstracted from the world. Something cannot be abstract from the world without the senses, that means everything abstracted from the world would be referred to as a "sensation".
Blue is a sensation, just like fuzziness, dirty, warm, or comfy, etc. These are all abstractions from the world.

>"quasi-actual"
"almost real"
>"projections"
Originating from within the self, being forced outward.
>"suspicions"
Suspecting. "I suspect I am ill"
>"repression of actual things"
Repression means to push away from the conscious mind, and actual things refers to objects/objective information.
An extreme example would be something like...
Someone believing they will fall ill with the bubonic plague, even though zero people have caught the disease.

A clarification about abstraction, it is something that has been abstracted which means "to have been removed from an object". Intuitions are never removed from objects, as it is never part of the object in the first place. So an intuition is never abstract from the world. Intuitions are created within the self through an unconscious process, that process can be "initiated", for lack of a better term, by an object in the world though.

>boredom is highly associated with Ne
Oh, I realize what you are referring to as boredom, Jung also talks about it.
>He can never exist in stable, long-established conditions of generally acknowledged though limited value: because his eye is constantly ranging for new possibilities, stable conditions have an air of impending suffocation.

Basically you cam only ever feel enjoyment presently because the future and past is just a projection ahead or behind from the perpetually occupied present. And it's just this realization that I suffered in a wagie job for like a year straight, with this idea in my mind, a projection ahead that if that I sacrifice these moments and efforts now the payoff will compensate. And I'm very quickly finding it doesn't. The present, the presence of myself, my existence here as my body typing this is overall just classed as the presence of dissatisfaction, incompleteness, lack, discomfort, pain, anxieties, sufferings, etc. On the whole living as this body is a chore, a pain, something to deal with and I've very quickly found that just because this body is in an unfamiliar land or place, it coesnt change its fundamentals. I'm born into a hellscapenof suffering and pain, desire and lack, ill cope and deal and suffer and struggle against and seek to mitigate and fulfill, and as I do this my body ages and I will die. What happens beyond I don't know what happened prior I don't know. But what's happening now I prefer it's absence.

>>71754832
Yep we're basically sold an idea on travel agencies or Instagram that the height of life is foreign destinations amd the greatest learning and lessons are some 3rd world shithole and if you want to be worldly you have to visit tourist destination #47445.

It's bullshit. You should spend your money on security. Buying land, a house, a weeding, setting yourself up long term with a career or something. Yes, travelling is fun but only in the context of a break from a secure life to go back to. A family vacation. A beach house. A getaway with the kids.

Dropping everything, disconnecting from your family, everyone you know, your country, your safety net just to go wander round foreign countries? For what? A few dopamine rushes of "toruist experiences"?

I learned more in my life reading debating and studying philosophy than traveling. I had more hedonistic experiences literally just taking drugs from the internet than travelling. All I feel now while traveling is not a sense of novelty, just a monotony of the same 'dealing with' that is being a human body, except this time devoid of all close relationships, family, or any sense of a home or life to return to.

Hello, Anon, need some help? A shoulder to cry on? Sit down and let's have a little chat.

STEP #1, HYGIENE AND HOME:
Brush your teeth twice a day, morning and evening. Scrub'em good with all the movements you can think of, circles, up and down, lateral, front and behind. This will take somewhere around 2 minutes. Floss once a day.
Moisturize your face with a cream after washing your face in the morning.
Depending on how much you sweat shower every or every second day.
Get a haircut every 2 months. If you are balding just cut'em short, anything else looks shit and insecure about it.
If your clothes are ripped, stretched and discolored as shit, get some new ones. Basic, monotone, cheap shirts will do just fine. Again, depending on your sweat wear'em between 1 and 3 days, then change. If you got a pile of dirty rags wash it.

This brings us to your home. Doesn't matter if you live alone or with your parents, clean your dwelling once a week. Empty bottles and packages are to be thrown away immediately, instead of hoarded. It's no work if you do it this way. Used plates, glasses, etc., are to be washed off immediately after use. Again, if you do it like this, it's way less work than cleaning off a whole pile of them.
Changing bed sheets and vacuuming the place once a week.

A healthy mind lives in a clean body, living in a clean place. All that grime on yourself and around you poisons your mind. This regime gets rid of that without too much effort. You will also feel a sense of accomplishment, which boosts you for what comes next, LEAVING THE HOUSE

STEP #2, LEAVE HOUSE:
Go out every day. Do long walks of atleast 2 hours. Explore your city, your surroundings. Go into alleys you never walked before. Whenever you think, oh whats there or I never was there or anything similiat, thats where you go!
Do not ask yourself shit, like "whats the use? Enjoy the moment, do not drown out your surrounsings with your depressive thoughts.

XGXG

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
STEP #3, SOCIALIZE:
I want you to greet people on your walks. Not some barely audible mumble, but a clear greeting. Establish eye contact, throw'em a good day coupled with a nod or a quick wave. I want your face to glow and your voice to echoe joy when you do this. Doesnt matter if its forced and unnatural at first, its training, if it came natural to you we wouldn't have to have this conversation.

After a few weeks or months of doing everything I told you, you should feel better about yourself. You wont be chad, fucking bitches left and right and going through life constantly happy, but at leaat you wont feel absolutely miserable for once. You may be able to pull off more intense forms of socializing now.

Get into the habit of doing smalltalk with strangers, like cashiers or the people you meet on walks. It doesn't matter that it's benign and trivial shit, just do it. Observe them, what they wear, their hair, makeup, tatoos, whatever and throw them a compliment, ask them where they got it from, what meaning it holds to them. When the convo naturally found its end, say your goodbye and go on your way.

STEP #4, GET A REAL HOBBY:
You should be prepared now, physically and mentally, to go out there and take the risk of trying new stuff, which will include meeting people doing the same stuff, but you are ready for that.

Here are things I can vouche for: Bouldering/climbing, martial arts, swimming, biking, skating, going to a chess/go/shogi/mahjong/etc center where you can watch, learn and play. If you like reading, go to a library instead of doing it at home. Generally, I advise you to engage mind and body. Try several physical activities and intellectual/creative ones.

At this point it should become a self perpetuating cycle. Keep challenging yourself, keep experiencing,exploring and learning new things.
Learn to "live in the moment". Dont question the use or meaning, do not rationalize, try to let the stimuli wash over you like a river.

XGXG

>what do you think I should try?
What I meat by this is to try being more mindful of stuff. Or to always preface everything in your head with the notion that it's all kind of meaningless inherently/that's it's an artificial construct. Think of yourself as metaphorically (or really if you want to) being stuck in a simulation, and observe that pretty much anything (including sexual preference) is just unauthentic and made up! There's lots of things that can support you in such an endeavor. Studying the history of sexuality or looking at different cultures and examining ethics of things involving it are good choices for your particular problem, but you can always go further and start questioning all values or experiences that you see, in which case some general knowledge of metaphysics and/or ethics would probably be recommended. Of course you don't actually need to do any kind of research here. I'm just listing these things to show you that there's a plethora of well-documented viewpoints which when adopted can hopefully rid you of those redundant thoughts.
So in short I mean, do whatever it takes to remove that authority or sense which those negative thoughts have. Because they're as arbitrary as anything else!

Anyway, how's your day been? And did you find the first dead space spooky?

I find racism perfectly concordant with my psychedelic experiences and philosophical studies. Separation may be an illusion and part of a universal unity in a false universe where all consciousnesses have the potential to rise and fall away from enlightenment, but it's still a part of this material universe. After psychedelics I find myself kinder and more empathic to trannies, niggers, leftists and even jews as my brothers, deceived and misguided and doing their best from their own perspective, yet still believe some lifeforms are closer to enlightenment than others as they experience reincarnation. And how could I know the truth of this universal system and judge myself as closer to enlightenment? The more I try to get it, the more I realize the importance of the physical world. Maybe the darkie stealing bikes and beating up people is more enlightened than the insecure upper class redditor defending his actions because he is more in tune with this physical realm and his desires and needs in it. Tiger and dragon and all that.

I can't tell if following biological instinct to distrust difference is a good idea or not, but the instinct is there for a reason - because it represents uncertainty and danger which can absolutely fuck you and your loved ones up in the material world. For this reason I am racist, it is perfectly rational to be so. Maybe love is the one true liberator of minds to lead a good life and transcend, or just the demiurge's most heinous barrier to keep us trapped in this dream, hard to tell. I wouldn't say it's made me less racist, but it's made me appreciate my experiences with the real world more and appreciate less the divisive idpols twitter would spew at you. And it turns out those experiences tell me to be racist.

tl;dr, No, Im just more comfortable with being racist.

I don't believe in giving children adhd meds because there's no point apart from managing potentially extreme behavioural issues. not only did the hyperactivity remain, but the loss of concentration, motivation, organisation, impulse control, short term memory, ability to socialise all massively increased. and no I didn't grow up stuck to a TV or playing vidya or on a computer unsupervised. As I got older and the all the above negatives effects started happening I just withdrew from everything and stayed in my room reading and listening to music. I wouldn't have spent my entire not really doing anything. I had every opportunity given to me to succeed except parents that did not believe adhd wasn't real. it wasn't until I was 21 and several years deep into frequent drug use that I worked out I had adhd. only now am I being prescribed meds and its made me realise how much of my life has passed by without achieving anything whilst watching my friends and siblings continue to succeed. even now with stimulants I just don't have the motivation to catch up with people my age. Researchers from Indiana University say that nearly 1 in 3 U.S. men, ages 18 to 24, reported no sexual activity in the past year.

The declines in partnered sexual activity seen in our study are consistent with findings from studies in the U.K., Australia, Germany and Japan.

During that time, the researchers found that sexual inactivity had increased from 19 percent to 31 percent among men age 18 to 24. Men and women age 25 to 34 also reported an increase in sexual inactivity during the time period. Dearest Muriem,

I am afraid that I may have some unfortunate news. I fear that I may die soon. I have not told anyone but the pain grows worse every day. It seems that I decided far too late to begin to care for myself and I am now passing a point from which I cannot return. There may be a point soon in my future that you come to hear that I have leapt from a bridge. Do not be alarmed by this for it is not due to any lack of will to live nor is it anything within your power to influence. I am simply in great pain and would prefer to take my life while I still have some sanity left. This is however not what I have written to communicate to you.

I wanted you to know that you were the reason that I could fight in the first place. You opened my eyes to possibilities I had never imagined. No matter how hard things got all I had to do was imagine your smiling face and then everything became a little easier. Whenever I would feel down all I had to do was remember your warm hugs and I knew that everything would be okay. I do not expect this to mean anything to you, I just wanted you to understand the effect that you've had on my life just by being yourself. I have found the lessons and what you have chosen to take from some of them to be quite beautiful. That is something that I have tried to carry forward as well.

Thank you and those that inspired you to be who you are today for giving me the chance to get to know you. To get to experience new things I had never before experienced. I appareciated every minute of it and carry those memories with me always.

I hope that you are well and fairing better than I. I hope for you all the happiness that I could never give, and the stability that you so very much deserve. Thank you for being a part of my life.

Sincerely, James.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71707191
I spent the first 2-3 years regularily trying to cut all of this out of my life. I would spend a few days just pretending like I never had a waifu, like this character meant nothing to me. Eventually, I would get this strong feeling, I'd miss them.
I was afraid of "waifu" and anime fans, and thought it was the way to spiral to degeneracy and a failed life. I thought, maybe I could just snap out of it and stop being like that, I thought there's no way I fell in love unironically.
Nowadays, when I think about giving up what I feel, it feels rude, and like so much work. I found a warm side to lean on, maybe in an unusual way and place, maybe it's very out-of-character for who I normally am, but it's real nonetheless. Every bone in my body hated the life I live right now, and my waifu managed to convince all of them otherwise, one after the other.
I might have lost a bit of my rationality on the way, and I don't want to sound cheesy, but I think it was worth it.

>>71720651
Kana was born in 1967, but her story starts in 1986. Generations in her world don't correspond to ours because of different technology and different major events. She was born 45 years after the end of the last major war but based on an older story I wrote, the internet was pretty widespread years before she was born, so she probably has what we might term a zoomer mindset (Kana loves social media and like zoomers, lacks a grasp on the complexity of her world). Or maybe she's a millennial, since she was a teenager when the last major financial crisis started. It's hard to say.
>headcanon her to be a different age
I like to think of her as "forever 19", but that might change in the next few years as I'm a decade older than her. Her love interests aren't much older than her, and I often imagine myself in their body which is nice since I can be young again and closer to her age

>>71749215
>Would you rather invite your husbando/waifu on a date, or would you rather have your waifu/husbando invite you?
She'd typically be the one to invite me on dates. Usually by saying "Oh we don't have class on [x day], so let's go on a date! Honestly, I like it like that. Her assertiveness is good.
>Where would you two go?
If it's up to us, always a theme park. No matter whether it's close or far. It's my autistic interest, and she likes to have fun there, so it's a pretty great date choice for us.
>What'd you do there?
Well ride some rides obviously. But also we'd take some time to soak in some detail, the atmosphere in general, and just relax. The good ones have lots of hidden details which we love.
>What'd you two wear?
On our recent vacation she wore a different outfit for each day. Typically she likes to wear her usual clothes, since they already look pretty, but if it's a really special date she will get a dress on, which looks equally nice.
>When is the date?
Usually just whenever we're able. She also likes to do "tactical dates" where she instantly plans one whenever I'm in a rut of feeling like shit. Usually it helps at least a bit. Regarding having special events soon, I suppose my birthday is in a few weeks, and we might do something special for that. We'll see.
>Is there something you'd like to gift them while you're on a date?
No, not really. Gifts are for gifting time. We'd rather be doing things together on a date than giving each other items - the memories are their own gifts. She does have some interest in getting some, though.

2) a tuxedo because its formality provides a nice contrast to his ordinary practical, casual fashion style. he would only ever willingly wear a tuxedo during events of utmost importance, such as our wedding
3) a karate gi because it only suits him as a japanese martial artist. he'd enjoy wearing this outfit since he's a lover of his craft
>what nicknames would YOUR waifu call YOU?
none, he only calls me by my given name without any honorifics, which often makes my heart skip a beat because i'm not used to being called by anything other than my nickname
